{"step_by_step_thinking": "The station of the fetal head is a measure of how far the head has descended into the pelvis, measured by the relationship to the ischial spines of the mother. A station of 0 means the head is at the level of the ischial spines. A positive station indicates that the head has descended below the ischial spines, while a negative station indicates that the head is above the ischial spines.", "answer_choice": "B. 1 cm below the ischial spine"}
